summary.p: Through a specially commissioned messenger, Ryhiner delivers two letters addressed to Bullinger (including one from the Landgrave [Philipp] of Hesse) [No. 2454 and No. 2455], which Johann Meyer, the city clerk of Strasbourg, sent to him with a request for further forwarding.

div.p: Worthy, highly learned, gracious, dear lord and friend, I am ready to serve you willingly as before. The esteemed, well-regarded Mr. Johann Meyer, city clerk of Strasbourg, my dear lord and friend, has sent me the two enclosed letters and missives, which are addressed to you (and one of which is said to be written to you by the Landgrave of Hesse), and has written and requested that I send both to you by a reliable messenger and as quickly as possible. I hereby do so, sending you the letters by a specially commissioned messenger. I am entirely willing and inclined to show you love and service.
Dated Saturday, the 19th day of June, in the year 1546. Heinrich Ryhiner, city clerk of Basel.
To the worthy, highly learned Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, teacher of the Holy Scriptures in Zurich, my gracious, dear lord and friend.
